page.title: 17Yarm Viaduct
page.content: Yarm Viaduct was built in{1849}but was not opened until 1852. It was designed by engineers{Thomas Grainger}and{Mr. {John Bourne.}It is 623 metres long It has 43 arches and 7 million bricks. Each arch spans about 12 metres over land and 19 metres over the river. It is 17 metres high and 9 metres wide. The cost in 1849 was{Â£44,500.}It is built from yellow sandstone and brick. { Thomas Grainger}was chief engineer of the Leeds and Thirsk Railway from Northallerton to Stockton and Hartlepool. In 1851 the Leeds and Thirsk Railway became known as the Leeds Northern and later in 1854 it amalgamated with two other lines to become the North Eastern Railway. More recently the section of line between Harrogate and Northallerton has been dismantled leaving the line as a branch from Northallerton northwards.
